creator.name: Commissie tot de Zaken der Protestantse Kerken in Nederlands Oost- en West-Indië
creator.name_english: Committee on behalf of the affairs of the Protestant churches in the Netherlands East and West Indies
creator.his_func:
After the dissolutions of the VOC (1795) and the West India Company (WIC) (1791) the defence of the Protestant church in the Dutch colonies came into the hands of the Dutch state. Therefore, in 1815 King Willem I established the Committee on behalf of the affairs of the Protestant Churches in the Netherlands East and West Indies, also known as the "Haagsche Commissie" or "Indische Commissie" or the "Commissie ad res Indicas".

The Committee was intended as a link between the government and the Protestant churches in the Netherlands. It had to advise and to report at the service of the Ministry of Commerce and the Colonies, and it was involved in the posting of reverends.

The influence of the Committee was less in the West Indies than in the East Indies.
